info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 08 at 10:46PM CDT until May 09 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN UNION...ALEXANDER...NORTHERN SCOTT...CENTRAL CAPE GIRARDEAU AND NORTHEASTERN STODDARD COUNTIES... At 1045 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Tamms to near Olive Branch to near Benton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 1039 PM CDT, a 72 mph gust was recorded at the Cape Girardeau Airport. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Cape Girardeau, Jackson, Scott City, Anna, Chaffee, Cairo, Jonesboro, Oran, Benton, Tamms, Kelso, Delta, Gordonville, Dutchtown, Olive Branch, Cape Girardeau Airport, Ware, Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area, Thebes and Allenville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 4. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 81 and 106. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
